001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.text.MessageFormat;
004import java.util.IdentityHashMap;
005
006import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
007
008import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.CaseChanging;
009
010/**
011 * Formats a LogEvent message.
012 *
013 * @apiNote This is sealed at the moment and maybe unsealed in the future so exhaustive
014 * pattern matching should not be done.
015 */
016@CaseChanging
017public sealed interface LogMessageFormatter {
018
019        /**
020         * Formats and appends the results.
021         * @param builder output.
022         * @param message message usually with formatting delimiters for replacement.
023         * @param arg1 to use for replacement.
024         */
025        void format(StringBuilder builder, String message, @Nullable Object arg1);
026
027        /**
028         * Formats and appends the results.
029         * @param builder output.
030         * @param message message usually with formatting delimiters for replacement.
031         * @param arg1 to use for replacement.
032         * @param arg2 to use for replacement.
033         */
034        void format(StringBuilder builder, String message, @Nullable Object arg1, @Nullable Object arg2);
035
036        /**
037         * Formats and appends the result.
038         * @param builder output.
039         * @param message message usually with formatting delimiters for replacement.
040         * @param args array of args.
041         */
042        default void formatArray(StringBuilder builder, String message, @Nullable Object[] args) {
043                formatArray(builder, message, args, args.length);
044        }
045
046        /**
047         * Formats and appends the result.
048         * @param builder output.
049         * @param message message usually with formatting delimiters for replacement.
050         * @param args array of args.
051         * @param length of args array which will be used even if args is larger.
052         */
053        void formatArray(StringBuilder builder, String message, @Nullable Object[] args, int length);
054
055        /**
056         * Built-in message formatters.
057         */
058        @CaseChanging
059        public enum StandardMessageFormatter implements LogMessageFormatter {
060
061                /**
062                 * SLF4J format style where "<code>{}</code>" is replaced with the parameters. The
063                 * implementation largely comes from the SLF4J but optimized for StringBuilder.
064                 */
065                SLF4J() {
066                        @Override
067                        public void format(StringBuilder builder, String message, @Nullable Object arg1) {
068                                SLF4JMessageFormatter.format(builder, message, arg1);
069                        }
070
071                        @Override
072                        public void format(StringBuilder builder, String message, @Nullable Object arg1, @Nullable Object arg2) {
073                                SLF4JMessageFormatter.format(builder, message, arg1, arg2);
074                        }
075
076                        @Override
077                        public void formatArray(StringBuilder builder, String message, @Nullable Object[] args, int length) {
078                                SLF4JMessageFormatter.format(builder, message, args, length);
079                        }
080                },
081                /**
082                 * java.util.logging MessageFormat style.
083                 */
084                JUL() {
085
086                        @Override
087                        public void format(StringBuilder builder, String message, @Nullable Object arg1) {
088                                try {
089                                        String result = MessageFormat.format(message, arg1);
090                                        builder.append(result);
091                                }
092                                catch (RuntimeException e) {
093                                        formatBadPattern(builder, message, e);
094                                }
095                        }
096
097                        private static void formatBadPattern(StringBuilder builder, String message, RuntimeException e) {
098                                builder.append(message)
099                                        .append(" ")
100                                        .append("[MessageFormat failed: ")
101                                        .append(e.getMessage())
102                                        .append("]");
103                        }
104
105                        @Override
106                        public void format(StringBuilder builder, String message, @Nullable Object arg1, @Nullable Object arg2) {
107                                try {
108                                        String result = MessageFormat.format(message, arg1, arg2);
109                                        builder.append(result);
110                                }
111                                catch (RuntimeException e) {
112                                        formatBadPattern(builder, message, e);
113                                }
114
115                        }
116
117                        @Override
118                        public void formatArray(StringBuilder builder, String message, @Nullable Object[] args, int length) {
119                                try {
120                                        String result = MessageFormat.format(message, args);
121                                        builder.append(result);
122                                }
123                                catch (RuntimeException e) {
124                                        formatBadPattern(builder, message, e);
125                                }
126                        }
127
128                }
129
130        }
131
132}
133
134final class SLF4JMessageFormatter {
135
136        private static final char DELIM_START = '{';
137
138        // private static final char DELIM_STOP = '}';
139        private static final String DELIM_STR = "{}";
140
141        private static final char ESCAPE_CHAR = '\\';
142
143        private SLF4JMessageFormatter() {
144        }
145
146        public static void format(final StringBuilder sbuf, final @Nullable String messagePattern,
147                        final @Nullable Object arg1) {
148                format(sbuf, messagePattern, arg1, null, null, 1);
149        }
150
151        public static void format(final StringBuilder sbuf, final @Nullable String messagePattern,
152                        final @Nullable Object arg1, final @Nullable Object arg2) {
153                format(sbuf, messagePattern, arg1, arg2, null, 2);
154        }
155
156        public static void format(final StringBuilder sbuf, final @Nullable String messagePattern,
157                        final @Nullable Object @Nullable [] args, int length) {
158                if (args == null || length == 0) {
159                        format(sbuf, messagePattern, null, null, null, 0);
160                        return;
161                }
162                else if (length == 1) {
163                        format(sbuf, messagePattern, args[0], null, null, 1);
164                        return;
165                }
166                else if (length == 2) {
167                        format(sbuf, messagePattern, args[0], args[1], null, 2);
168                        return;
169                }
170                else {
171                        format(sbuf, messagePattern, null, null, args, length);
172                }
173        }
174
175        private static void format(final StringBuilder sbuf, //
176                        final @Nullable String messagePattern, //
177                        final @Nullable Object arg1, //
178                        final @Nullable Object arg2, //
179                        final @Nullable Object @Nullable [] args, //
180                        final int argCount) {
181
182                if (messagePattern == null) {
183                        return;
184                }
185
186                if (argCount == 0) {
187                        sbuf.append(messagePattern);
188                        return;
189                }
190
191                int i = 0;
192                int j;
193                int L;
194                for (L = 0; L < argCount; L++) {
195
196                        j = messagePattern.indexOf(DELIM_STR, i);
197
198                        if (j == -1) {
199                                // no more variables
200                                if (i == 0) { // this is a simple string
201                                        sbuf.append(messagePattern);
202                                        return;
203                                }
204                                else { // add the tail string which contains no variables and return
205                                                // the result.
206                                        sbuf.append(messagePattern, i, messagePattern.length());
207                                        return;
208                                }
209                        }
210                        else {
211                                if (isEscapedDelimeter(messagePattern, j)) {
212                                        if (!isDoubleEscaped(messagePattern, j)) {
213                                                L--; // DELIM_START was escaped, thus should not be incremented
214                                                sbuf.append(messagePattern, i, j - 1);
215                                                sbuf.append(DELIM_START);
216                                                i = j + 1;
217                                        }
218                                        else {
219                                                // The escape character preceding the delimiter start is
220                                                // itself escaped: "abc x:\\{}"
221                                                // we have to consume one backward slash
222                                                sbuf.append(messagePattern, i, j - 1);
223                                                Object arg = resolveArg(L, arg1, arg2, args, argCount);
224                                                deeplyAppendParameter(sbuf, arg, null);
225                                                i = j + 2;
226                                        }
227                                }
228                                else {
229                                        // normal case
230                                        sbuf.append(messagePattern, i, j);
231                                        Object arg = resolveArg(L, arg1, arg2, args, argCount);
232                                        deeplyAppendParameter(sbuf, arg, null);
233                                        i = j + 2;
234                                }
235                        }
236                }
237                // append the characters following the last {} pair.
238                sbuf.append(messagePattern, i, messagePattern.length());
239        }
240
241        private static @Nullable Object resolveArg(int i, @Nullable Object arg1, @Nullable Object arg2,
242                        @Nullable Object @Nullable [] args, int argCount) {
243                if (i >= argCount || argCount == 0) {
244                        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(i);
245                }
246                if (argCount > 2) {
247                        if (args == null) {
248                                throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(i);
249                        }
250                        return args[i];
251                }
252                else if (i == 0) {
253                        return arg1;
254                }
255                else if (i == 1) {
256                        return arg2;
257                }
258                throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(i);
259        }
260
261        final static boolean isEscapedDelimeter(String messagePattern, int delimeterStartIndex) {
262
263                if (delimeterStartIndex == 0) {
264                        return false;
265                }
266                char potentialEscape = messagePattern.charAt(delimeterStartIndex - 1);
267                if (potentialEscape == ESCAPE_CHAR) {
268                        return true;
269                }
270                else {
271                        return false;
272                }
273        }
274
275        final static boolean isDoubleEscaped(String messagePattern, int delimeterStartIndex) {
276                if (delimeterStartIndex >= 2 && messagePattern.charAt(delimeterStartIndex - 2) == ESCAPE_CHAR) {
277                        return true;
278                }
279                else {
280                        return false;
281                }
282        }
283
284        /*
285         * The below is adapted code from SLF4J
286         */
287        // special treatment of array values was suggested by 'lizongbo'
288        private static void deeplyAppendParameter(StringBuilder sbuf, @Nullable Object o,
289                        @Nullable IdentityHashMap<@Nullable Object[], @Nullable Object> seenMap) {
290                if (o == null) {
291                        sbuf.append("null");
292                        return;
293                }
294                if (!o.getClass().isArray()) {
295                        safeObjectAppend(sbuf, o);
296                }
297                else {
298                        // check for primitive array types because they
299                        // unfortunately cannot be cast to Object[]
300                        if (o instanceof boolean[]) {
301                                booleanArrayAppend(sbuf, (boolean[]) o);
302                        }
303                        else if (o instanceof byte[]) {
304                                byteArrayAppend(sbuf, (byte[]) o);
305                        }
306                        else if (o instanceof char[]) {
307                                charArrayAppend(sbuf, (char[]) o);
308                        }
309                        else if (o instanceof short[]) {
310                                shortArrayAppend(sbuf, (short[]) o);
311                        }
312                        else if (o instanceof int[]) {
313                                intArrayAppend(sbuf, (int[]) o);
314                        }
315                        else if (o instanceof long[]) {
316                                longArrayAppend(sbuf, (long[]) o);
317                        }
318                        else if (o instanceof float[]) {
319                                floatArrayAppend(sbuf, (float[]) o);
320                        }
321                        else if (o instanceof double[]) {
322                                doubleArrayAppend(sbuf, (double[]) o);
323                        }
324                        else {
325                                if (seenMap == null) {
326                                        seenMap = new IdentityHashMap<>();
327                                }
328                                objectArrayAppend(sbuf, (@Nullable Object[]) o, seenMap);
329                        }
330                }
331        }
332
333        private static void safeObjectAppend(StringBuilder sbuf, Object o) {
334                try {
335                        String oAsString = o.toString();
336                        sbuf.append(oAsString);
337                }
338                catch (Throwable t) {
339                        // Util.report("SLF4J: Failed toString() invocation on an object of type [" +
340                        // o.getClass().getName() + "]", t);
341                        sbuf.append("[FAILED toString()]");
342                }
343
344        }
345
346        private static void objectArrayAppend(StringBuilder sbuf, @Nullable Object[] a,
347                        IdentityHashMap<@Nullable Object[], @Nullable Object> seenMap) {
348                sbuf.append('[');
349                if (!seenMap.containsKey(a)) {
350                        seenMap.put(a, null);
351                        final int len = a.length;
352                        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
353                                deeplyAppendParameter(sbuf, a[i], seenMap);
354                                if (i != len - 1)
355                                        sbuf.append(", ");
356                        }
357                        // allow repeats in siblings
358                        seenMap.remove(a);
359                }
360                else {
361                        sbuf.append("...");
362                }
363                sbuf.append(']');
364        }
365
366        private static void booleanArrayAppend(StringBuilder sbuf, boolean[] a) {
367                sbuf.append('[');
368                final int len = a.length;
369                for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
370                        sbuf.append(a[i]);
371                        if (i != len - 1)
372                                sbuf.append(", ");
373                }
374                sbuf.append(']');
375        }
376
377        private static void byteArrayAppend(StringBuilder sbuf, byte[] a) {
378                sbuf.append('[');
379                final int len = a.length;
380                for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
381                        sbuf.append(a[i]);
382                        if (i != len - 1)
383                                sbuf.append(", ");
384                }
385                sbuf.append(']');
386        }
387
388        private static void charArrayAppend(StringBuilder sbuf, char[] a) {
389                sbuf.append('[');
390                final int len = a.length;
391                for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
392                        sbuf.append(a[i]);
393                        if (i != len - 1)
394                                sbuf.append(", ");
395                }
396                sbuf.append(']');
397        }
398
399        private static void shortArrayAppend(StringBuilder sbuf, short[] a) {
400                sbuf.append('[');
401                final int len = a.length;
402                for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
403                        sbuf.append(a[i]);
404                        if (i != len - 1)
405                                sbuf.append(", ");
406                }
407                sbuf.append(']');
408        }
409
410        private static void intArrayAppend(StringBuilder sbuf, int[] a) {
411                sbuf.append('[');
412                final int len = a.length;
413                for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
414                        sbuf.append(a[i]);
415                        if (i != len - 1)
416                                sbuf.append(", ");
417                }
418                sbuf.append(']');
419        }
420
421        private static void longArrayAppend(StringBuilder sbuf, long[] a) {
422                sbuf.append('[');
423                final int len = a.length;
424                for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
425                        sbuf.append(a[i]);
426                        if (i != len - 1)
427                                sbuf.append(", ");
428                }
429                sbuf.append(']');
430        }
431
432        private static void floatArrayAppend(StringBuilder sbuf, float[] a) {
433                sbuf.append('[');
434                final int len = a.length;
435                for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
436                        sbuf.append(a[i]);
437                        if (i != len - 1)
438                                sbuf.append(", ");
439                }
440                sbuf.append(']');
441        }
442
443        private static void doubleArrayAppend(StringBuilder sbuf, double[] a) {
444                sbuf.append('[');
445                final int len = a.length;
446                for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
447                        sbuf.append(a[i]);
448                        if (i != len - 1)
449                                sbuf.append(", ");
450                }
451                sbuf.append(']');
452        }
453
454}
